question: The patient was admitted after one week of daily rectal bleeding with each bowel movement, also noticing clots of blood. She experienced associated dizziness, left-sided chest pressure, palpitations, and mild pleuritic chest pressure. Upon admission, she was found to have a hematocrit of 14.8, for which she received 7 units of packed red blood cells. A CT of the chest revealed a right-sided pulmonary embolus. The patient was discharged on Lovenox and Warfarin for a provoked DVT/PE.
